title.__cdata: PSV Advance In Champions League Play-offs After 2-1 Win At Galatasaray

description.__cdata: Istanbul (AP) PSV Eindhoven advanced to the Champions League's third qualifying round after beating hosts Galatasaray 2-1  to win the second round tie 7-2 on aggregate.    	 Noni Madueke's deflected shot eight minutes before half-time on Wednesday put PSV ahead on the night and captain Marco van Ginkel extended the lead from a Mario Gotze cross just before the hour-mark.  	 The visitors were reduced to ten men when Olivier Boscagli picked up a second yellow card for a foul on Mbaye Diagne in the 73rd minute.	 Substitute Diagne then volleyed in an eye-catching goal 11 minutes later, but it was a mere consolation for Galatasaray.  	 PSV will face Danish side Midtjylland in the next round, while Galatasaray dropped into the third qualifying round of the Europa League, where they will meet St Johnstone of Scotland. AP     SSC SSC 07290514 NNNN..

title.__cdata: Mexico Says Officials Spent USD 61 Million On Pegasus Spyware

description.__cdata: Mexico City (AP) Mexico's top security official said Wednesday that two previous administrations spent USD 61 million to buy Pegasus spyware that has been implicated in government surveillance of opponents and journalists around the world.  	Public Safety Secretary Rosa Icela Rodrguez said records had been found of 31 contracts signed during the administrations of President Felipe Caldern in 2006-2012 and President Enrique Pea Nieto in 2012-18. Some contracts may have been disguised as purchases of other equipment..
